Def.Name: Shining Willow
Def.Description: Tall shrub or small tree growing to 20' in height. May be shaped like a pyramid.
Def.Leaves: Shiny green, narrow lance-shaped. 1 9/16" - 6" long and 3/8" - 1 3/8" wide. May have stipules at the leafstalk base.
Def.Twigs: Brown/orange, red/yellow, shiny, break very easily at base.
Def.Range: Swamps, shores and wet meadows in Minnesota, north Iowa, North Dakota, Labrador, Newfoundland to Saskatchewan, south to Delaware, Ohio, Iowa, and South Dakota.
